summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing how to add a victim's contact information to a notification system. The victim, who met with prosecutors the previous day, is represented by three attorneys from the firm Kaiser Saurborn & Mair P.C. The emails coordinate obtaining consent to contact the attorneys to determine who should receive case notifications.

events.title: Prosecutors meet with Epstein victim
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutors met for the first time with an Epstein victim in the afternoon.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) was actively communicating about victim outreach and notification procedures in July 2019.
A victim of Jeffrey Epstein met with prosecutors for the first time on July 12, 2019.
The victim was represented by three attorneys from the law firm Kaiser Saurborn & Mair P.C.: Daniel Kaiser, William Kaiser, and Kimberly Lerner.
Prosecutors were coordinating to add the victim to a notification system and needed to determine which law firm(s) should receive updates.
The email chain shows procedural coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding victim contact and attorney communication.
